Iron Hulk | powers= * Superhuman strength and durability * Supersonic flight * Flamethrowers * Energy repulsor and missile projection * Regenerative life support }} The '''Iron Patriot''' is a [[patriotism]]-themed [[powered exoskeleton|exoskeleton]] used by several fictional characters appearing in [[American comic book]]s published by [[Marvel Comics]]. ==Publication history== The concept of the Iron Patriot, which is meant to evoke [[Iron Man]] and [[Captain America]], first appeared in ''[[Dark Avengers]]'' #1 (March 2009) and was created by [[Brian Michael Bendis]] and [[Mike Deodato]]. ==Fictional history== ===Norman Osborn=== {{Main|Norman Osborn}} [[File:Iron Patriot (Norman Osborn).jpg|thumb|left|[[Norman Osborn]] as Iron Patriot. Art by [[Adi Granov]].]] Norman Osborn donned the original Iron Patriot armor during the ''[[Dark Reign (comics)|Dark Reign]]'' storyline to exert his authority as "commander" of [[H.A.M.M.E.R.]] and the [[Dark Avengers]] while using [[Oscorp]]'s resources.''Dark Avengers'' #1 However, the Iron Patriot's star-shaped Uni Beam projector had a less powerful output.''Dark Reign: The List – Spider-Man'' #1 Unsurprisingly, Osborn's activities as the Iron Patriot have been jeopardized by the original [[Avengers (comics)|Avengers]]: Osborn gets tricked into attacking [[Iron Man|Tony Stark]],''The Invincible Iron Man'' #19 and when the [[The New Avengers (comics)|New Avengers]] led by [[Bucky Barnes|Captain America]] used the Iron Patriot's tracking device on [[Luke Cage]] as a trick to destroy his own house.''The New Avengers'' #60 During Osborn's [[Siege (comics)|invasion]] of [[Asgard (comics)|Asgard]] on the grounds of a national security threat, the Iron Patriot is disabled during Osborn's fight with [[Captain America|Steve Rogers]], revealing Osborn's [[Green Goblin]]-like face paint.''Siege'' #1–4 When Rogers, Stark and [[Thor (Marvel Comics)|Thor]] transfer him to the [[Raft (comics)|Raft]] penitentiary, Osborn blames his Goblin alter-ego for ruining his chance to protect America as the Iron Patriot.''Dark Avengers'' #16 {{-}} ===James Rhodes=== {{Main|War Machine}} James Rhodes temporarily wore the Iron Patriot armor in ''Secret Avengers'' vol. 2 and the ''Iron Patriot'' series.''Secret Avengers'' vol. 2 #6''Iron Patriot'' #1-5 ===Iron Patriot Drones=== The Iron Patriot Drones make occasional appearances. One is seen during the ''[[Fear Itself (comics)|Fear Itself]]'' storyline to assists the New Avengers, but the Iron Patriot Drone is vaporized by the [[Sin (Marvel Comics)|Red Skull]]'s powers.''The Avengers'' vol. 4 #17 Another drone is seen during the ''[[Marvel NOW!]]'' event. At a weapons expo that the [[Secret Avengers]] were attending, the Iron Patriot Drone is a target for [[Advanced Idea Mechanics|A.I.M.]] which is almost interrupted by [[Nick Fury, Jr.]] and [[Daisy Johnson]]. The [[Scientist Supreme]] takes the opportunity to steal and replicate the Iron Patriot Drone.''Secret Avengers'' vol. 2 #3 Its low-level A.I. grew considerably as an army of sentient drones, which A.I.M. used to incriminate the United States in numerous international attacks. The Iron Patriot Drones are sent to attack [[Iran]] to which [[S.H.I.E.L.D.]] sent the [[Hulk]] in response.''Secret Avengers'' vol. 2 #4 S.H.I.E.L.D. uses holographic communication to hack into the A.I.M. network so the Iron Patriot Drones can understand these programmed actions are wrong. The Iron Patriot Drones are next seen during the "[[Inhumanity (comics)|Inhumanity]]" storyline as the Secret Avengers' support involving the [[Inhumans]] until being disabled by the Junkman's technopathic abilities.''Secret Avengers'' #10. Marvel Comics. ===Toni Ho=== {{Main|Toni Ho}} Dr. Toni Ho wore two versions of her own Iron Patriot armor as a member of the [[U.S. Avengers]]; a standard version,''U.S. Avengers'' #1. Marvel Comics. and a heavy combat variation.''U.S. Avengers'' #3. Marvel Comics.''U.S. Avengers'' #6. Marvel Comics. ===Sharon Carter=== {{Main|Sharon Carter}} Sharon Carter briefly wore the Iron Patriot armor to combat [[Selene (comics)|Selene]].''Captain America'' vol. 9 #23. Marvel Comics. ==Other versions== ===American Son=== The '''American Son''' is another patriotic-themed exoskeleton used by [[Harry Osborn]] during the "[[Dark Reign (comics)|Dark Reign]]" storyline,''The Amazing Spider-Man'' #597-599. Marvel Comics. and later by [[Gabriel Stacy and Sarah Stacy|Gabriel Stacy]].''Amazing Spider-Man presents: American Son'' #1-4. Marvel Comics. ===Iron Hulk=== The '''Iron Hulk''' is an alias used by [[Robert Maverick|Robert Maverick / Red Hulk]].''The Avengers'' #683-684. Marvel Comics. ===Hydra Supreme / Civil Warrior=== A variation of Steve Rogers utilized elements of Tony Stark's armor in order to control [[Hydra (comics)|Hydra]] as the Hydra Supreme / Civil Warrior.''Secret Empire'' #9-10. Marvel Comics. The armor would later be utilized by Veronica Eden.''Captain America/Iron Man'' #2-5 ===Ultimate Marvel=== The [[Ultimate Marvel]] equivalent of the Iron Patriot appears due to [[Iron Man (Ultimate Marvel character)|Tony Stark / Iron Man]] inspired by [[Captain America (Ultimate Marvel character)|Steve Rogers / Captain America]] for the [[Ultimates]].''Ultimate Comics: Ultimates'' #19-21. Marvel Comics.''Ultimate Comics: Ultimates'' #22-23. Marvel Comics. ==In other media== ===Television=== * Norman Osborn / Iron Patriot appears in ''[[Ultimate Spider-Man (TV series)|Ultimate Spider-Man]]'',{{cite web|url=http://www.comicbookresources.com/?page=article&id=46629|title=UNMASKING "ULTIMATE SPIDER-MAN's" Rogues with Cort Lane - Comic Book Resources|date=15 July 2013|publisher=comicbookresources.com|access-date=2014-04-05}}{{cite web|url=http://www.thefutoncritic.com/listings/20131003disneyxd31/|title=Listings - ULTIMATE SPIDER-MAN on DISNEY XD | TheFutonCritic.com|publisher=thefutoncritic.com|access-date=2014-04-05}} voiced by [[Steven Weber]].{{cite episode|title=Second Chance Heroes|series=Ultimate Spider-Man|network=Disney XD|season=2|number=23|airdate=October 20, 2013}} This version sports the second version's design used by subsequent users in the original comic. Additionally, two more Iron Patriot armors appear in Oscorp's armory, with one resembling the original version's design. ** Furthermore, the American Son armor, referred to as the '''Patrioteer''', is used by Harry Osborn, voiced by [[Matt Lanter]].{{cite episode|title=Iron Vulture|series=Ultimate Spider-Man vs. the Sinister Six|network=Disney XD|season=4|number=4|airdate=March 6, 2016}} * Two versions of the Iron Patriot sporting the design used by subsequent users in the original comic appears in ''[[Avengers Assemble (TV series)|Avengers Assemble]]''. ** First appearing in "Exodus", the regular Iron Patriot armor is seen as a part of Tony Stark / Iron Man's [[Iron Legion]].{{cite episode|title=Exodus|series=Avengers Assemble|network=Disney XD|season=1|number=25|airdate=May 18, 2014}} In "Avengers Disassembled" and "The Ultimates", the Iron Patriot is hijacked by [[Ultron]] and used to attack the [[Avengers (comics)|Avengers]]. In "New Year's Resolution", the Iron Patriot is merged with [[Kang the Conqueror]]'s time-travelling robot sent to eliminate [[Howard Stark]] and [[Peggy Carter]].{{citation needed|date=November 2020}} ** The heavy combat Iron Patriot armor, equipped with a shield, appears in "World War Hulk", in which it is utilized by Steve Rogers / Captain America.{{cite episode|title=World War Hulk|series=Avengers: Ultron Revolution|network=Disney XD|season=3|number=22|airdate=November 20, 2016}} ===Film=== * The second Iron Patriot armor appears in ''[[Heroes United|Iron Man and Captain America: Heroes United]]'' (2014), where it is used by Steve Rogers / Captain America for a practice fight. * The Iron Patriot appears in live-action films set in the [[Marvel Cinematic Universe]], primarily used by [[James Rhodes (Marvel Cinematic Universe)|James Rhodes]].{{Cite web|url=https://comicbook.com/marvel/2019/07/29/avengers-endgame-fan-discovers-war-machine-iron-patriot-suit/|title = Eagle Eyed Avengers: Endgame Fan Discovers Where War Machine's Iron Patriot Suit Came from}} In ''[[Iron Man 3]]'' (2013), the concept is created as a response to the [[Battle of New York (Marvel Cinematic Universe)|Battle of New York]] and is later used by [[Coldblood|Eric Savin]] to capture President [[Matthew Ellis]].{{cite web|url=http://screenrant.com/iron-man-3-iron-patriot-war-machine-spoilers/|title=Iron Man 3: The Story Behind Rhodey & The Iron Patriot Armor|last=Keyes|first=Rob|date=March 23, 2013|publisher=Screen Rant}} A heavy combat version appears in ''[[Avengers: Endgame]]'' (2019).{{Cite web|url=https://comicbook.com/marvel/news/avengers-endgame-war-machine-cosmic-armor-revealed/|title = Avengers: Endgame Script Reveals War Machine's Iron Patriot Armor Has Spacefaring Capabilities}} ===Video games=== * Norman Osborn / Iron Patriot appears as a playable character in ''[[Marvel Super Hero Squad Online]]'', ''[[Marvel Contest of Champions]]'', ''[[Marvel Puzzle Quest]]'' and ''[[Marvel: Future Fight]]''. * The MCU Iron Patriot armor appears in ''[[Marvel Super Hero Squad Online]]'',https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=BcqqS8wSBBg (049:54 / 153:31) ''[[Iron Man 3: The Official Game]]'', ''[[Marvel: Avengers Alliance]]'', ''[[Lego Marvel Super Heroes]]'',{{cite web|url=http://www.ign.com/articles/2013/07/20/lego-marvel-super-heroes-characters-and-cast-revealed|title=LEGO Marvel Super Heroes: Characters and Cast Revealed|first=Greg|last=Miller|date=20 July 2013}} ''[[Disney Infinity: Marvel Super Heroes]]'', ''[[Marvel Heroes (video game)|Marvel Heroes]]'', ''[[Lego Marvel's Avengers]]'', and ''[[Marvel: Future Fight]]''. * The Iron Patriot armor appears as an alternate costume for Tony Stark / Iron Man in ''[[Ultimate Marvel vs. Capcom 3]]'',{{cite web|url=http://www.comicbookresources.com/article/exclusive-rosemann-talks-marvel-games-fourth-of-july-celebrations|title=EXCLUSIVE: Captain Marvel, Sam Wilson & More Celebrate Fourth of July with Marvel Games|date=July 2015}}{{cite web|url=http://i.annihil.us/u/prod/marvel/i/mg/9/10/4d5a0c0d2c994/detail.jpg|title=u/prod/marvel/i/mg/9/10/4d5a0c0d2c994/detail|publisher=i.annihil.us|access-date=2014-04-05}} and ''[[Iron Man VR]]''. * The Iron Patriot armor appears as an alternate costume for Steve Rogers / Captain America in ''[[Marvel Avengers Academy]]''. * The Civil Warrior appears as a playable character in ''[[Marvel Contest of Champions]]''. Additionally, the Iron Hulk armor is utilized by the [[Maestro (character)|Maestro]]. ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [http://marvel.wikia.com/Iron_Patriot Iron Patriot] at Marvel Wiki * [http://marvel.wikia.com/American_Son American Son] at Marvel Wiki {{Dark Avengers}} {{New Avengers}} {{Iron Man}} {{Captain America}} {{S.H.I.E.L.D.}} {{Goblin (Marvel Comics)}} [[Category:Marvel Comics superheroes]] [[Category:Iron Man]] [[Category:Captain America]] [[Category:Fictional armour]] [[Category:S.H.I.E.L.D. agents]] [[Category:United States-themed superheroes]]
